question: What is the drug of choice in cestode infection?
Which of the following drug is the preferable treatment in the case of neurocysticercosis?
Which of the following is an appropriate drug in the treatment of acute enteric fever?
Which of the following is graze is synonymous to?

The district government of a certain city is trying to control a malaria epidemic. For this purpose, they want to initiate the strategy of vector control. They launch the distribution of insecticide-treated nets (ITNs) to households. Which of the following captures the other core intervention that must be used for effective vector control?

A non-governmental organization working to control malaria in flood-affected areas of Pakistan seeks advice from a public health specialist regarding the control and elimination of malaria. Which one of the following options captures the most appropriate advice?

A physician is interested in performing entomological testing on the mosquito which is an important vector for transmitting viral fevers in Pakistan. Which of the following mosquitoes is of interest to him?

A 29-year-old woman reported to your clinic with complaints of sudden onset chills and high fever, intense headache, muscle and joint pain. The joint pain restricted her movements for the last two days. A provisional diagnosis of Chikungunya infection was made. What will be the next appropriate patient management step should be taken?

answers.option: Prevent person-to-person direct transfer of infection
Ensure oral rehydration and give acetaminophen
Administer NSAIDS for severe muscle and joint pain

question: A patient presents to the outpatient department with a history of cough for more than three weeks, night sweats, loss of appetite, and fever. The physician advises a chest x-ray, sputum culture, and Zeihl-nelson staining of the sputum. He was diagnosed as a case of tuberculosis. Which one of the following is an identifying feature of tuberculosis?

Malaria is an intermittent and remittent fever caused by a protozoan parasite that invades the red blood cells and is transmitted by mosquitoes in many tropical and subtropical regions. Anopheles mosquito takes a blood meal from humans and injects which of the forms of plasmodium parasite?

A 33-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with a three-day history of a white, fishy vaginal discharge. She has no history of sexually transmitted disease, post-coital bleeding, or dysuria. On speculum examination, there is a milky fluid in the posterior fornix but no signs of inflammation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

The journey of leukocytes from the vessel lumen to the tissue is a multi-step process mediated and controlled by adhesion molecules and cytokines called chemokines. Which one of the following statements is correct regarding sequential phases?

answers.option: Margination inside the endothelium and vessel wall
Rolling, margination, and adhesion to endothelium
Adhesion, margination, and rolling to endothelium
Margination in a tissue towards a chemotactic stimulus
Margination, adhesion, and rolling to endothelium

question: A 3-year-old unvaccinated girl is brought to the outpatient department with fever, cough, runny nose, and watery eyes for 3 days. On physical examination, there is a maculopapular rash on the face, neck, and trunk. Her elder sibling has a history of similar complaints from 1 week ago. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 6-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department with complaints of high-grade fever (102°F) for 4 days. On physical examination, the child is febrile with cropped vesicles on the trunk and scattered scabbed lesions. Which of the following infections is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old female presents with complaints of purulent vaginal discharge and intermenstrual bleeding. Gram staining of endocervical screening revealed the presence of gram-negative diplococci. What would be the diagnosis?
Once the fusion of HIV takes place with the host cell, viral RNA is released into the cytoplasm. Viral RNA is then used to synthesize dsDNA by which of the following enzymes?

HIV uses a CD4⁺ molecule as a receptor, which is present in CD4⁺ cells such as T-lymphocytes, macrophages, monocytes, dendritic cells other and antigen-presenting cells. Virus entry into the human cell is mediated by which of the following proteins?

A young man presented to the emergency room with a history of high-grade fever associated with chills and rigors. He lives in an area of poor sanitation, streets with stagnant water, insects, and mosquitoes. A complete blood count (CBC) examination of blood from the patient revealed distorted RBCs, double in size, and Schüffner's dots. What is the causative agent?

Balanced infection control practices (ICP) can save hospitals a considerable amount of money, e.g., an outbreak of GNR can be controlled effectively by hand hygiene rather than prescribing expensive antibiotics. "The first requirement in a hospital is that it should do the sick no harm." Who said the above words?

A 50-year-old male patient enters the emergency department with a profuse, productive cough. The infection control nurse instructs the patient's attendant to take their patient to the separate waiting area at the corner. Which of the following is the segregation of patients before they enter the usual waiting room?

A young child presented to the outpatient department with a history of low-grade fever, loss of appetite, and lethargy. Blood culture is positive for Salmonella typhi. Salmonella typhi is transmitted by which of the following routes?

A 24-year-old male patient presents with pain in his left knee and a burning sensation during urination. On examination, he has noticeable conjunctival inflammation. He denies any recent gastroenteritis but has had several sexual partners and has not always used protection. Which organism is most likely responsible for his presentation?
What are the four rules of professional-patient relationships set forth and explained by Beauchamp and Childress?

answers.option: Respect for autonomy, non-maleficence, beneficence, and justice

question: What is the concept of justice in ethics?

answers.option: Taken as patients right to choose or refuse treatment
To keep the secrecy of patient
For medical professionals to do good for all patients under all circumstances
An obligation of the patient to the society
Health resources must be distributed according to the principals of equity

question: Regarding expressed oral consent, which of the following statements is correct?

answers.option: It should be signed by both, doctor as well as patient
It is taken in minor procedures
It is taken for unconscious patients
It should be signed by the patient only

question: In which of the following circumstances can confidentiality be breached?

answers.option: For a patient who requires invasive treatment
When the patient does not listen to the doctor
When financial resources are scarce and patient is not compliant
When a patient authorizes to do so

question: Which of the following is accepted by professional medical societies, and by the law under certain circumstances?

Transplantation terminology contains terms to describe the relationship of the graft donor to the graft recipient. Which of the following is the correct terminology for a graft between genetically non-identical members of the same species?
In a court of law, leading questions are permitted exclusively during cross-examination. What is the only other circumstance in which the prosecution can pose leading questions?

A dying female victim of domestic violence recorded her deposition in the hospital, which is under oath and in the presence of the magistrate and accused, regarding the circumstances of her death. Why does a dying deposition carry more weight than a dying declaration?

answers.option: Oath of the dying person is an essential prerequisite
It is recorded in the presence of the accused
Remains valid even after the recovery of the depositor
It is recorded by a magistrate

question: Which of the following terms describes all legal means that help a fact, the truth of which is submitted in judicial proceedings?

An injured person with a broken leg was being transported to the hospital in an ambulance. At a signal crossing, suddenly another vehicle collided with the ambulance resulting in the death of the injured person. What legal principle or concept is most applicable to this scenario?

The parents presented a 3-year-old female child to the outpatient department with a one-week history of fever and cough, accompanied by conjunctivitis and coryza for the past three days. Notably, the child's elder brother experienced a similar condition characterized by a maculopapular rash all over his body two weeks ago. What is the likely problem with this child?
The parents brought a 10-year-old male child with a history of fever for 10 days. On examination, the child appears sick, febrile, and toxic. What is the gold standard test for diagnosis?
Which of the following is the first choice drug for the treatment of enteric fever?
Which of the following is the drug of choice for a cestode infestation?
Which of the following is a protease inhibitor used in combination for treatment of HIV?
Which of the following statements is correct about anti-staphylococcal antibiotics?

A 27-year-old nursing mother is diagnosed as suffering from genital herpes. She has a history of this viral infection. Previously, she responded to a drug used topically. Which drug to be used orally is most likely to be prescribed at this time?

A patient with AIDS has a CD4 count of 45/µL. He is being maintained on a 3-drug regimen of indinavir, didanosine, and zidovudine. Which of the following drugs may cause an episode of acute pancreatitis?

A premature neonate suffered respiratory distress and was given an antibiotic 100 mg/kg/day orally. Over the next two days, his condition worsened. He became dull, stopped feeding, and developed abdominal distention, and an ashen grey appearance. Which is the most likely antibiotic given to him?

An 8-year-old child presented with brownish discolored and deformed anterior teeth. He has a history of taking an antibiotic about 4 years earlier. Which antibiotic could be responsible for the condition?
Which enzymes are the target for the quinolone antibacterial agents?
Which fluoroquinolone is highly active against Mycobacterium leprae and is being used in alternative multidrug therapy regimens?

A 35-year-old male presented to the outpatient department with a prolonged history of fever and weight loss. On clinical examination, there is lymphadenopathy and hepatosplenomegaly. Complete blood count (CBC) shows pancytopenia. He is suspected of visceral leishmaniasis. Which of the following investigations is used for definitive diagnosis of visceral leishmaniasis?

answers.option: Identification of amastigote in macrophages in tissue sample

question: A 16-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a three-day history of high-grade fever, flu, itchy red eyes, and rashes all over the body. On examination, the physician found Kolpik spots in the oral cavity and a maculopapular rash scattered all over the body. The most likely diagnosis will be?

A 50-year-old female while cleaning her home sustained a rusty metal injury on her right finger. She is very cautious and came to seek treatment at the emergency department. You have washed her wound with normal saline and dressed it. Which of the following infections she is at risk of acquiring?

A 20-year-old college student presented to the medical specialist with complaints of fever, extra-orbital pain, and fatigue for one week. On examination, the patient is febrile and has a macular skin rash. The lab results reveal a Hb of 11 g/dl, a TLC of 3500 cells/dl, a platelet count of 50,000, and an increased hematocrit. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old man presented to the skin specialist with complaints of skin lesions on his face and arms for six months. The lesions are hypopigmented and lack sensation. On examination, the skin over the brows and ears has thickened, and there are nodules on the face. He was diagnosed as having leprosy. Which of the following statements is correct?

answers.option: Lepromin skin testing is positive in lepromatous types of leprosy
Tuberculin skin test is positive for any type of leprosy
The lepromin skin test is positive in the tuberculoid type of leprosy
There is no role for cell-mediated immunity, but granulomas are usually absent
Its clinical presentation is not classical

question: A 19-year-old woman presented to the emergency department after complaining of abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting for 2 hours. Her abdominal pain is sudden, and she has no history of fever or diarrhea. She had taken fried rice, grilled chicken, and vegetables for lunch five hours before at a local restaurant. What is the most likely mechanism responsible for the symptoms?

answers.option: Proliferation with subsequent production of toxins by bacteria
Bacterial invasion of the small intestine
Bacterial invasion of the large intestine

question: A 36-year-old man presented to the emergency room with complaints of fever and mild abdominal pain for 3 days. On examination, he is febrile (103°F) with jaundice and a palpable spleen. Plasmodium falciparum trophozoites are visible in the peripheral film. In cases of uncomplicated falciparum malaria, which treatment is recommended?

A 24-year-old man from Baluchistan presented to the dermatology clinic complaining of an erythematous nodule in his right arm that had been bothering him for a month. There are no such lesions located on the ears, lips, or oral mucosa. The systemic review was unremarkable. The histopathology of the lesion shows granulomatous inflammation in the dermis and peripherally located amastigotes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male presented with fever and abdominal pain. His illness started with low-grade fever and decreased appetite. He has been unwell for the past 7 days and has per rectal bleeding for the last 2 days. Initially, he took per ciprofloxacin for 3 days followed by oral cefixime and azithromycin for 4 days. He was started on intravenous (IV) ceftriaxone. What is the most appropriate diagnostic test?

answers.option: Complete blood picture with peripheral film

question: What is the main aim to perform an autopsy?

answers.option: To look for signs of life
To identify the cause of death
To look for any possible injuries
